document.docAuthor: Gravili, Cinzia, Vito, Doris De, Camillo, Cristina Gioia Di, Martell, Luis, Piraino, Stefano & Boero, Ferdinando
document.masterDocTitle: The non-Siphonophoran Hydrozoa (Cnidaria) of Salento, Italy with notes on their life-cycles: an illustrated guide

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The non-Siphonophoran Hydrozoa (Cnidaria) of Salento, Italy with notes on their life-cycles: an illustrated guide

subSubSection.paragraph: Material examined. HCUS-S 0 98 (Hydrozoa Collection, University of Salento—fauna of the Salento Peninsula).

Hydroid. Hydrorhiza as tubular, branching stolons; colonies erect; hydrocauli monosiphonic, up to ca 30 mm , unbranched, axis base athecate, ending with an oblique node, remaining internodes thecate with distinct or indistinct transverse nodes, each with a pair of frontally placed, opposite hydrothecae; hydrotheca tubular, basal half parallel with axis, distal half curving outwards forming 45 º with the axis, 1 / 2 — 2 / 3 of adcauline walls of each pair of hydrothecae touching frontally. Gonothecae almost spherical, with rounded transverse ridges and truncated distally, aperture circular on a short collar, operculum with one circular valve.

Substrate. Algae, leaves and rhizomes of
Posidonia oceanica
, rock, hydroids, polychaete tubes, bryozoans, other organisms such as sponges, cirripedes, molluscs, and holothurians.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 91.
Dynamena disticha
: A , hydrothecae; B , variability of the hydrothecae; C , gonotheca (A, B, C same scale bar); D , nematocysts (drawn by F. Boero). Scale bars: A, B, C, 0.5 mm; D, 20 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks For a complete discussion about the taxonomy of this variable species see
Calder ( 1991 )
.
